name: Introduction to Economics
description: This course introduces students to the principles and foundations of economic decision-making.

name: Intermediate Microeconomics
description: This course covers the fundamentals of microeconomic theory, including consumer and producer theory, market structure, and welfare economics.

name: Intermediate Macroeconomics
description: This course covers the fundamentals of macroeconomic theory, including economic growth, inflation, unemployment, and monetary and fiscal policies.

name: Econometrics
description: This course covers the fundamentals of econometric methods, including linear regression analysis, hypothesis testing, forecasting, and time series analysis.

name: Environmental Economics
description: This course covers the economic principles and models used to analyze environmental and natural resource issues.
